intro: Ormenis fuscata, commonly known as the dark ormenis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Ormenis fuscata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
